com.parse4cn1.util

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.parse4cn1.util.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    Minimalist file logger. Logs to the default CN1 log file.

    By default, debug logging is disabled and should not not be enabled in production code for performance and security reasons (sensitive information may be inadvertently logged).

      • getInstance

        public static Logger getInstance()

      • isDebugEnabled

        public boolean isDebugEnabled()
        Checks if debug logging is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if the debug logging is enabled; otherwise, returns false.

      • setLogLevel

        public final void setLogLevel(int logLevel)
        Sets the desired log level.

        logLevel and all higher log levels will be enabled after calling this method.

        Parameters:
        logLevel - The minimum log level.

      • debug

        public void debug(java.lang.String data)
        Logs a debug message.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to be logged.

        public void error(java.lang.String data)
        Logs an error message.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to be logged.

      • getLogContent

        public java.lang.String getLogContent()
                               throws ParseException
        Retrieves the entire log content as a single long string to be used by the application in any way it deems fit.

        Note that if any buffered log is present (cf. logBuffered(java.lang.String)), it will be appended to the end of the string returned by this method.

        Returns:
        The log data if successfully retrieved or null.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if anything goes wrong.

      • showLog

        public void showLog()
             throws ParseException
        Creates and shows a form that contains the log data and an option to refresh it.

        Back navigation from this form returns the app to the form that was visible before this method was called.

        Throws:
        ParseException - if anything goes wrong.
        See Also:
        getLogContent()

      • logBuffered

        public static void logBuffered(java.lang.String data)
        Utility for writing logs when the initialization state of the CN1 framework is not known. This is only intended for debugging native code in the absence of a real debugger, without having to worry whether the underlying CN1 logging has been initialized or not.

        The data logged here will be added to the end of the string returned by getLogContent() and thus, also displayed in the form generated by showLog()

        Parameters:
        data - The data to be logged (at debug level).
